title: Janna quality of life change

replies.body: As with all skill shots, you need to wait to see where's it headed.

> [{quoted}](name=Corehog,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=HAdEibzG,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-06-15T09:18:17.002+0000)
>
> As with all skill shots, you need to wait to see where's it headed.

Yes, but Janna's tornado has a set directional vector from when it starts charging, the only thing that will change is the distance in that direction it will travel. This makes it a bit of an exception to the rule.

I agree that there could be some clarity given to this, however you can also just ping the angle/area you've prepped it for while its charging. This helps a lot to communicate that you're looking to go in on that when the enemy crosses that path.

i actually agree with this, we have markers and warnings for every other champ and situation.

Janna's tornado should have a friendly team indicator which direction its going and how far it will travel, would improve her synergy and play-ability with team quite well. 

And in a way, i think there should be maybe a .2-3second animation which gives a quick prewarning as to its direction for the enemy, not before it moves, but like some extra graphics just ahead so people have a bit more chance to avoid, in a hectic tense situation it'll rarely get noticed, but a quick flash of its direction as it launches would make it a more viable skill, rather than a charging tornado, sitting there, where does it go? 75% of the time the direction she was traveling in but hey... its not that great a skill considering its mana cost and CD compared to other supps...

I've just started playing Janna leveling shields first and rushing ardent censer with a frost queens blade and spec resolve tank dmg reduction and 12 points in cunning to sustain mana. I can actually live whilst running behind lane lines and knocking back with ulti and a tornado knock up, rather than defensive play till one lands and something can be done, whilst hoping i have taken 2 hits which takens 1/3rd-1/2half hp away pre6
I dunno. If she couldn't release it at will then that would be fine. But she can...
